content: Good app and very strong engine once you use the dev build but it leaves me baffled as to why the free website version is almost just as strong even with less thinking time. And when I use the website dev build it's stronger than the app‚ÄîWeird. They can do a couple things to improve my experience: 1) allow customizability of the board& peices. 2) Skrink the size of the board by default or have an option for it ‚Äîthis is so we can use the app in split screen mode. 3)have more engine options.
Waste of money
replyContent: Hi Ritesh and thank you for the review. Could you, for the benefit of myself and others, maybe expand on that a little? I just now pushed out a update to the Android app -- 2.3.0 -- which has a significantly more responsive interface and support for Stockfish 12.

content: Good.
Please refund my money. App is working slow.

The most wasting money for an app! The algorithm is perfect only if you are a beginner and play with a beginner! The programmer must be restated! I installed today, tested with several amateur good players, lost the majority! ü§Æ
replyContent: The algorithm is the Stockfish chess engine. Humans at any skill level generally don't beat Stockfish. I'm genuinely interested in this. The app has diagnostic capabilities (engine log) that might yield some clues. If you haven't given up on NCM completely, email me at chendry@nextchessmove.com and I'll make sure we get it researched and corrected!

content: Not a good user experience . UI should be more intuitive and calculate next move should be automated .... üòê .. it went too costly for an average user experience ... Sorry .. disappointed ...

Will edit this review as i gain more experience using the app but the customer support has been amazing so far! They are really appreciative of genuine customers and value our feedback, the app is really good so far too, i highly reccomend giving it a go if you're looking for this kind of app :)
Make a chess play option. So that every time I shouldnt have to click on the calculate button
For some reason the app only shows moves from whites perspective
replyContent: Greetings, and thank you for the review! You can toggle which color the app calculates for by tapping the pawn icon to the right of the calculate button. You're not the first to bring this up - it is admittedly not the best interface. I think we need to incorporate the text "white" and "black" into the icon, and make it actually look like a button.
